remarks: Membership is inherited by predecessors.  The converse, for all ordinals, implies excluded middle, as shown at ~ onsucelsucexmid .  However, the converse does hold where ` B ` is a natural number, as seen at ~ nnsucelsuc .  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 17-Jul-2019.)
statement: onsucelsucr $p |- ( B e. On -> ( suc A e. suc B -> A e. B ) ) $.
